column4: hello i am trying to add mediabuntu to my rep. but it keeps failling "sudo -E wget --output-document=/etc/apt/sources.list.d/medibuntu.list http://www.medibuntu.org/sources.list.d/$(lsb_release -cs).list && sudo apt-get --quiet update && sudo apt-get --yes --quiet --allow-unauthenticated install medibuntu-keyring && sudo apt-get --quiet update"
i have wasted 1hr trying to get this thing to work instead of studying
does 'rei' and then hitting TAB not work in chatzilla?
opps , sorry i am just frustrated
if you can upload one somewhere I can take a look at it, determine what you need
the teacher gave them to us to watch and then write about the scenarios

No suitable decoder module:
2012-05-31T04:17:00.000Z	piper69_	reisio	i am on 10.10
2012-05-31T04:18:00.000Z	reisio	piper69_	windows media video 9 is relatively new and not 100% supported, your best bet would be to use a live snapshot from mplayer trunk
2012-05-31T04:18:00.000Z	piper69_	reisio	?!
2012-05-31T04:18:00.000Z	reisio	piper69_	alternatively, tell your instructor you're already paying for the class and don't need to be forced to use Windows on top of it
2012-05-31T04:20:00.000Z	reisio	piper69_	http://www.andrews-corner.org/mplayer.html
2012-05-31T04:22:00.000Z	reisio	piper69_	or... go to a computer lab and convert them
2012-05-31T04:22:00.000Z	reisio	piper69_	or, as already mentioned, tell your instructor you shouldn't be charged an additional $200 just to watch some videos for his class
2012-05-31T04:23:00.000Z	reisio	piper69_	and if you upload one of the files I can tell you whether svn mplayer supports it or not
